attributes.action: Make the wearing of a face mask in shops and public places compulsory by law.
attributes.additional_details: This virus is spreading at an unprecedented rate and still people refuse to wear a face mask and adhere to Government guidelines. Shopkeepers are being placed in an invidious position on refusing access to people not wearing a face mask and not keeping social distancing, as currently they do not have the backing of the law. Having a law making it compulsory to wear a face mask in shops and public places would allow shopkeepers to call on Police for assistance.
attributes.background: Pass a law making it compulsory to wear a face mask in shops and public places. Failure to wear a face mask without reasonable excuse will result in a fine and the person liable to be arrested in serious cases or refusal to give their details.

rejection.details:
In England you must wear a face covering in a number of indoor settings, including shops, unless you are exempt: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/face-coverings-when-to-wear-one-and-how-to-make-your-own/face-coverings-when-to-wear-one-and-how-to-make-your-own#when-to-wear-a-face-covering

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign: 

Make face-masks mandatory in all public spaces - indoors and out: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554917

Make it compulsory to wear a face covering in enclosed public spaces: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328214
